question: Which country's important political movement was the "Fennoman Movement"?
explanation: Fennoman Movement was an important political movement of Finland in the 19th century. The members of this group were known as Fennomans. They founded the Finnish party and started the language conflict, which armed to raise the Finnish language and Finnic culture from peasant status to the position of a national language and national culture. The opposition of this group was Svecomans, who defended the status of Swedish. Johan Vilhelm Snellman was one of the most influential Fennomans.
